intro: Oziroe biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered oziroe, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in pairs, giving it its scientific name. It typically grows in woodland and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Oziroe biflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and fragrant blooms.
